NAME: Congo Louis
COMMENTS: Freed to serve as executioner. Given land,complete ration of wines and drinks, full time use of his wife who remains slave of Company ofthe Indies. Document found in ANC,C13A 9, fols. 267-8,copie des deliberations du Sup Counc of La, Oct 24,Nov. 21, 1725

NAME: Thereze
COMMENTS: Jean Mingo to work to pay for the freedom of Therese. Document involves director of the concession granting permission for Therese to marry.  Children of this union to be freed. see 1729.10.21.02 for work contract.

NAME: Mingo Jean
COMMENTS: No emancipation document for Jean Mingo, but he is a free black who marries & works for freedom of his wife Therese.

NAME: Jean Roussin
TERMS: Debts of decedent must be paid
COMMENTS: Jean Roussin and his wife freed under will of Sr. Cazeneuve confirmed.  If the debts are paid legacy can stand.

NAME: Wife of Jean Roussin
TERMS: Debts of decedent must be paid
COMMENTS: Jean Roussin and his wife freed under will of Sr. Cazeneuve confirmed.  If the debts are paid legacy can stand.

Duplessis seeks to carry out Viard will freeing OSAGE slave and 100 pistolles cash bequest to teach her Catholicism. Council ratifies liberty. Slaves can't receive cash which goes to Hospital and the slave will be trained by Ursuline Sisters.

REASONS: for military merit for service in Natchez massacre
COMMENTS: see LHQ IV,4, 527?  Document impossible to read, badly charred.

REASONS: good and agreeable services rendered,other reasons

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: Freedom granted in will LHC 1736022801 in which Meunier states he is leaving for the Chickasaw War not knowing if he will return. This act is the formal grant of liberty

FAMILY: Indian mother and her children, number not stated
COMMENTS: Will mentions only Female Indian and her infants no family size or names given.Slaves are left with Calixte Descairac by Nebouls on condition he free them. Descairac now does this under his will.

REASONS: Kept by testator for master so test. could free
COMMENTS: Will of Descairac. Has kept Indian mother and her children, no number of kids stated, for their master Nebouls who instructed him to free them.  He does so under his will.

REASONS: Kept by testator for master so test. could free
COMMENTS: Will of Descairac. Has kept Indian mother and her children, no number of kids stated, for their master Nebouls who instructed him to free them.  He does so under his will.

TERMS: husband to work to free her
COMMENTS: Husband freed for military service agrees to work to free his wife. Date is approximate.

NAME: Maranes
REASONS: being purchased by husband freed for military serv
COMMENTS: Had been freed previously. Claims 450 livre from estate of Pierre St. Julien. Wants it applied to purchase of freedom of his wife who is not to be sold till he can purchase her in full.

NAME: Almansor Pierre
COMMENTS: Contracted with physician of the King for treatment of venereal disease in return for service as cook or other work except wielding an ax or working the ground to begin after he was cured.

NAME: Janeton
COMMENTS: Since she was 23 years old, she has always served with zeal and fidelity, "depuis de vinght trois ans le quell la toujour servy avec zelle et fidelite."

NAME: Marie Angelique dit Isabelle
COMMENTS: This is confirmation of freedom granted by master. He attaches receipt for his payment in full in cash from the Company of the Indies dated October 5, 1732. She is freed for fidelity and service. LHQ9, 722.

NAME: Francoise
COMMENTS: He bought her from La Forest(sp?). She and her two mulatto children whom he bought from La Raquet are to be sent to France on the Conte de Maure, Capt. Berry, leaves them 2,000 l each to give them all possible education and every advantage.

NAME: Petit Marianne
COMMENTS: He bought her from La Forest(sp?). She and her two mulatto children whom he bought from La Raquet are to be sent to France on the Conte de Maure, Capt. Berry, leaves them 2,000 l each to give them all possible education and every advantage.

NAME: Pierrot
COMMENTS: He bought her from La Forest(sp?). She and her two mulatto children whom he bought from La Raquet are to be sent to France on the Conte de Maure, Capt. Berry, leaves them 2,000 l each to give them all possible education and every advantage.

NAME: Leveille
COMMENTS: Master is going to Chickasaw War,wants them freed during his voyages. Universal heir to keep them, raise them in the fear of God, with greatest possible gentleness provided they treat her with due respect, till children are old enough to earn a living.

NAME: Manon
COMMENTS: Master is going to Chickasaw War,wants them freed during his voyages. Universal heir to keep them, raise them in the fear of God, with greatest possible gentleness provided they treat her with due respect, till children are old enough to earn a living.

COMMENTS: In will dated 8/26/1738, leaves this family 3 arpents of land to be divided equally among the children. Parents get lifetime use of land. Nation and age from testimony dated 1739.04.02.01.

NAME: Marianne
COMMENTS: Three mulattoes promised their freedom before death of master. Not in will, but they did not appear in the inventory except perhaps this 6 year old girl. Petition of Wolof couple freed in will.

NAME: Pierre
COMMENTS: Three mulattoes promised their freedom before death of master. Not in will, but they did not appear in the inventory except perhaps this 6 year old girl. Petition of Wolof couple freed in will.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Three mulattoes promised their freedom before death of master. Not in will, but they did not appear in the inventory except perhaps this 6 year old girl. Petition of Wolof couple freed in will.

NAME: Jeanneton
COMMENTS: Master is deceased. Copy of will in succession file. Wife protests. Court held that wife must receive 1/2 of their appraised value and they can then be freed. Will provides that she work for hopital for 2 yrs.

NAME: Marie Jeanne
COMMENTS: Master is deceased. Copy of will in succession file. Wife protests. Court held that wife must receive 1/2 of their appraised value and they can then be freed. Will provides that she work for hopital for 2 yrs.

NAME: Pantalon
COMMENTS: All we know is that he is a Wolof free black who was accused of theft.

NAME: Gennevieve Iris
COMMENTS: Certificate of Bienville and Salmon that Genevieve Irisse is a free woman. She can marry when the Capuchins Fathers are willing.

REASONS: master leaving for France.  For good services.
COMMENTS: See 6/4/1737 for eman of mother. Mother had been freed by Bienville previously.  Bienville is leaving for France.

NAME: Haran Marie
COMMENTS: This is final petition for freedom granted by Superior council agreement made in 1737. Tiocin touwfreaw e negro. He was to work without remuneration from the hospital for 7 years. When the period was up the wife was to be freed . See 1737.07.12 .

NAME: Francoise
REASONS: For care given during Meunier's illness
COMMENTS: This emanicpation act is confirmed by the governor.

NAME: Jean Louis
REASONS: For care his mother gave during owner's illness
COMMENTS: This emanicpation act is confirmed by the governor.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: See 1738.10.20.01 for his will. SLAVE INDIAN OF THE FOX NATION. Document mentions the freedom. It is actually a donation of 3000 livres from a French man Francois Noyon to Marie to support her.

NAME: Jeanette
COMMENTS: See 1738.10.20.01 for his will. SLAVE INDIAN OF THE FOX NATION. Document mentions the freedom. It is actually a donation of 3000 livres from a French man Francois Noyon to Marie to support her.

NAME: Marion
COMMENTS: Freed by Pierre St. Julien on Oct. 9, 1735. Illegally sold and held by d'Ausseville and others. She was forced to pay her sale price. Asks 20 livre per month for her labor.

NAME: Matias Forcade
COMMENTS: Procuration to seek freedom of slave by Jacques Forcade to Anne Galbrean wife Barthelemy du Bic. Slave's owner is a resident of German Coast. Slave was born Rivere Aux Paules, baptized in Mobile. No price listed. Receipt in Forcade's trunk.

NAME: Joseph
REASONS: To be freed under will of Pierre Boyer
FAMILY: 2 mulatto brothers, sons of Marianne NL
COMMENTS: Their mother Marianne NL ordinarily lives with Claude dit La Comba.  All Boyer's property left to two mulatto kids to be administered by La Comba till they grow up.

NAME: Pierre
REASONS: To be freed under will of Pierre Boyer
FAMILY: 2 mulatto brothers, sons of Marianne NL
COMMENTS: Their mother Marianne NL ordinarily lives with Claude dit La Comba.  All Boyer's property left to two mulatto kids to be administered by La Comba till they grow up.

NAME: Marianne
REASONS: To be freed under will of Pierre Boyer
FAMILY: 2 mulatto brothers, sons of Marianne NL
COMMENTS: Their mother Marianne NL ordinarily lives with Claude dit La Comba.  All Boyer's property left to two mulatto kids to be administered by La Comba till they grow up. Can't find eman doc for Marianne but she was probably slave of Boyer since her kids were.

NAME: Venus
COMMENTS: Jean Baptiste Marly free negro agrees to serve as a cook for Jean Joseph de Pontalba of Point Coupee for 3 years in order to free his wife the slave Venus.  If Venus dies, he is to free his griffe daughter instead.

NAME: Marie Louise
COMMENTS: Document not emancipation but certification this person is free because she is the daughter of a Frenchman. Document states "Marie Louise n'est poins esclave et quell dois jois d'une pleine et entere libertee comme estante d'un francois."

NAME: Charlotte
COMMENTS: Slave Charlotte and her son Jean are freed. During the time Meullion remains in Louisiana the slave will serve him as a slave. She will enjoy her liberty only upon his return to France or his death in Louisana.

NAME: Jean
REASONS: as reward to mother for her services
COMMENTS: Slave Charlotte and her son Jean are freed. During the time Meullion remains in Louisiana the slave will serve him as a slave. She will enjoy her liberty only upon his return to France or his death in Louisana.

NAME: Mariane
COMMENTS: Mom and 2 kids declared to be free under will of their ex-master

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: Mom and 2 kids declared to be free under will of their ex-master

NAME: Pierre
COMMENTS: Mom and 2 kids declared to be free under will of their ex-master

NAME: Marie Anne
COMMENTS: Date is estimated. 1739 is the death of Coustillon. see doc notes for 1767103101 bequeathed 2000 livres. Unclear if this is the same slave.  He purchased two mulatto kids and sent them to France for education.
Sedella quotes letter from master asking for freedom for both of them.
MASTERMO: mother is slave, no names recorded

FAMILY: Twin mulatto boys freed together at baptism
COMMENTS: Sedella quotes letter from master asking for freedom for both of them.
NAMEMOM: Mother is slave, no names recorded.

NAME: Rosette
COMMENTS: Owner attached to the slave who is good natured. Wishes to give her her freedom and take care of her education. Petitions Gov. Kerlerec to free her in conformity with Article  50 Code Noir, Petition granted (DOCUMENT BAD DAMAGE HAD TO USE WPA SUMMARY)

NAME: Felicite
REASONS: Natchez Indian woman married to Julien free negre
FAMILY: Natchez Indian slave married to free black
COMMENTS: She is a Natchez Indian slave married to a free black.  She has an emancipation document from the estate of Widow St. Denis.

NAME: Caton
REASONS: naturally due to 2 old slaves for good service
FAMILY: Very old, dying husband and his wife,both freed
COMMENTS: Very old and moribund, freed with his wife Manon by the heirs

NAME: Manon
REASONS: naturally due to 2 old slaves for good service
FAMILY: Very old, dying husband and his wife,both freed
COMMENTS: very old and moribund, freed with her husband Caton by the heirs

NAME: Julien
COMMENTS: Natchez Indian female slave married to Julien FMC. Can't find emancipation references to him. Mentioned in this document. No information on means of emancipation.

NAME: Fanchon
REASONS: services and care and devotion during his illness
COMMENTS: In consideration of good and agreeable services received during his illnesses, "disant qu'en consideration des bonnes et agreeables serivces quil auroit recu dans ses maladies.
Document is rendering of the account of the D'Auberville by Madame D'Auberville listed as an old black given his freedom as her own domestic and a former domestic from the estate of her father.
Document is rendering of the account of the D'Auberville by Madame D'Auberville listed as an old black given his freedom as her own domestic and a former domestic from the estate of her father.

NAME: Poulierdon Jean Baptiste
FAMILY: wife Marie,50, is still slave, est price 4000 liv.
COMMENTS: Was listed in docno 1764.02.22 in LHC, inv. of M. Arnaud, for memoire, freedom authorized by Kerlerec.  Is employee. Wife is slave. She is 50 yrs. old.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: From document dated 1769.07.06.02. Widow objects to property going to Marie and son Francois Mulatre her deceased husband's natural child.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: From document dated 1769.07.06.02. Widow objects to property going to Marie and son Francois Mulatre her deceased husband's natural child.

NAME: Cezard
REASONS: very obligated, served with zeal and affection
COMMENTS: Begs governor and Administrator to confirm said freedom.

NAME: Marguerite
COMMENTS: It is noted that the masters are not married.

NAME: Francoise
COMMENTS: Acquired her from estate of Widow Chevel. Wanted to take her to Martinqiue but couldn't. Wants to free her and agrees to educate her. Documents signed by Gov. Kerlelerc & other officials who approve.

NAME: Pierrot
REASONS: Patoulas Indians, for faithfulness for 12 years.
COMMENTS: Freed is Patoulas Indian, served master, who is a hunter, faithfully for 12 years. Freed with Gennevieve sauvagesse. Next record

NAME: Gennevieve
COMMENTS: Indian woman served master, who is a hunter, faithfully for 12 years. Freed with Pierrot Sauvage, see previous record.
Child listed as slave at birth.  Then overwritten in text as free by Fr. Dagobert.
MASTERMO: mother is black slave, no names recorded

COMMENTS: Child listed as slave at birth.  Then overwritten in text as free by Fr. Dagobert.

NAME: Francoise
REASONS: good service rendered to her and her deceased hus

NAME: Laplante
REASONS: for over 40 yrs of service to her and her dead hus

NAME: Hypolite
COMMENTS: Must serve him until his death and his son after he grows up!

NAME: Isidore
COMMENTS: Must serve him until his death and his son after he grows up!

NAME: Mimy
COMMENTS: Acquired from Aubert at Mobile by purchase. Beautiful document approving act, with seals.

NAME: La Mirre
COMMENTS: After death of mistress, and she is to get 25 barrels of corn a year for the rest of her life.

NAME: Jean Baptiste
REASONS: This is a reenslavement for libertinage
COMMENTS: Reenslaved for libertinage, sold by King to Trudeau for 1000 livres (200 piastres). Can't determine if he was listed earlier as freed.

NAME: Marie
FAMILY: husband and wife - husband already free
COMMENTS: Husband purchases his wife's freedom from master's estate. Estate is 8 lieus below N.O. on east bank. This slave has been freed by acte de liberte authorized by Kerlerec on 12/15/1758.  Is employee. Wife is slave.

NAME: Jacques
COMMENTS: All slaves of estate ordered inventoried and sold except for Jacquot whose freedom is given to him. He was a jeweler. Got his tools as well.  Deceased was also a jeweler, gold and silversmith and a merchant.

NAME: Claude
COMMENTS: Unclear if child is metif (Indian/white mixture) or mulatre (black and white mixture) since mulatre was scratched out.

NAME: Francois
REASONS: Sold before the death of his mistress.
COMMENTS: See also 1765.11.02.02. Son of Manon jeune negresse,30.Testator has no heirs in colony.Leaves everthing to charity,but not to Maison des Pauvres.Executor bought him shortly before mistress died. Freedom annulled judicially. Debts exceeded assets.

NAME: Victoire
COMMENTS: He is about to take an ocean voyage. He also leaves her 2,000 livres reel. Leaves money to family & charity as well.  Brothers, sister in-law, etc.

NAME: Pierre
REASONS: good and agreeable services, good care
COMMENTS: He is about to take an ocean voyage.

NAME: Marguerite
REASONS: good and agreeable services, good care
COMMENTS: He is about to take an ocean voyage.

NAME: Michel
REASONS: good and agreeable services, good care
COMMENTS: He is about to take an ocean voyage.

NAME: George
REASONS: good and agreeable services, good care
COMMENTS: He is about to take an ocean voyage.

NAME: Charlotte
FAMILY: Chalotte NF,Louis Mulatre et Helene, her kids
COMMENTS: Testator fears he is near death.  Has considerable property which he leaves to various relatives as well. Asks his heirs to take care of them because of good and agreeable services which he has received all the time.

NAME: Louis
FAMILY: Chalotte NF,Louis Mulatre et Helene, her kids

NAME: Helene

NAME: Venus
COMMENTS: Estate of Margaritte Demouy estate #03-F-203-010-1766 in Slave database. Testator gives his wife's share of estate to Venus and in case of her death to her son Pierre. Widow objects.

NAME: Pierre
REASONS: Previous record, mother of his twin sons
COMMENTS: Estate of Margaritte Demouy estate #03-F-203-010-1766 in Slave database. Testator give his wife's share of estate to Venus and in case of her death to her son Pierre. Widow objects.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Francois Demouy, probably half brother, buys this enslaved twin from his mother's estate. Estate of Margaritte Demouy #03-F-203-010-1766. Testator give his wife's share of estate to Venus and in case of her death to her son Pierre. Widow objects.

NAME: Joseph Marie Baptiste
FAMILY: husband,wife,2 young kids, all Patouka Indians
COMMENTS: M. Despaliere and Claude des Roussels appear, explaining that Allemand, hunter, of Arkansas River, wanted to free Indian couple and their children but could not write and there was no notary there. He is now dead.

NAME: Catoche
FAMILY: husband,wife,2 young kids, all Patouka Indians
COMMENTS: M. Despaliere and Claude des Roussels appear, explaing that Allemand, hunter, of Arkansas River, wanted to free Indian couple and their children but could not write and there was no notary there. He is now dead.

Very high price! mother is Jacqueline mulatress slave of Jaques Lemelle. Child to remain with mother to 18 mos of age. If longer 20 sol/day paid by purchaser for upkeep. To be freed by purchaser.
Father is ship captain.  Mother Louisan metive, daughter is metive. Buyer obligates himself to give child freedom.  Mother gives her consent to sale.

NAME: Adrienne
COMMENTS: Slave is her godchild, "filleule." Already gave her her freedom, approved by  Superior Council. Also gives her 300 livres and whatever of her clothes she may leave.

NAME: Cestin  Celestin
FAMILY: Cestin and Marie, brother and sister

NAME: Marie
FAMILY: Cestin and Marie, brother and sister

NAME: Spadille
REASONS: has saved master's life several times.
COMMENTS: If there are not enough assets to pay creditors and also free slave, slave should have the right to choose his new master. Included inv. after death of master 11/14/1768. 1200 l. Sold to Baure 11/22/1768 for 1,000 l.

NAME: Roze
COMMENTS: Gave her to Mme. Chateau Goudeau for her use during her lifetime.  She cannot be sold. After donnee's death she is to be freed.

NAME: Fany Hormette
COMMENTS: Gave her to Mme. Chateau Goudeau for her use during her lifetime.  She cannot be sold. After donnee's death she is to be freed.

NAME: Manon
COMMENTS: Gave her to Mlle. Chateau Goudeau for her use during her lifetime.  She cannot be sold. After donnee's death she is to be freed.

NAME: Adrienne
COMMENTS: Negresse was also godchild of master?

NAME: Magdelin
COMMENTS: Not inventoried on estate, mulatresse fille de Manou, not inventoried with other slaves on Prevost estate.

Don Diego de Pecalvel presents a will by Andres Lopez Armesto, and he wants to have freed a certain Negra, the money to come from the sale of some of his (deceased's?) slaves and furniture. The negra slave belongs to the Capuchin mission.

NAME: Maylois or Magloire
COMMENTS: Discord in valuation process 800 and 600; 3rd estimator says 600 pesos is the price. New aprraiser named after review says price is 800P.Elena says she is overcharged. 800p remains price after 5th valuation. Record ends here no resolution to case.

NAME: Nue Maria
COMMENTS: Mentions Gov. Piernas, and all these other principal people.  Unsure if Perrault needs the Governor's approval to free this slave.

NAME: Joseph

NAME: Fanchon

COMMENTS: This slave is part of Mrs.and Mr. Marcantel's community property.  Price also is (includes?) a horse estimated at 30ps.  Is emancipated slave to keep the horse?

NAME: Juana
COMMENTS: Pedro was the former slave of Mr. Demouy. Pedro bought this slave from Luis Boisdore' on the 13th of Oct. 1780.  Not sure if Juana is his mother or his sister. Based on earlier document, I'm listing freer as her brother. GMH 1/23/2000.
natural child of free mulatto man and slave mulatto woman.

NAME: Nicolas

NAME: Juan

NAME: Venus
COMMENTS: Venus is the daughter of his black slave Nancy and reputedly of Dn. Christoval Beard, deceased. Leaves her 3 female & 3 male slaves to be given to her at the age of 18. Should she die without children these slaves revert to his property.
MASTERMO: Don Cristobal Beard, father of her child

NAME: Suson

NAME: Magdalena

COMMENTS: This is the will of Maria Francisca Riche who wants to use her estate money,if there is any left, to buy the freedom of her sister Maria Luisa's daughter, Magdalena, from Meillon. She names the same Meillon as her executor.

NAME: Pedro

NAME: Isabela
COMMENTS: Mother, Celesta, remains a slave. Will leaves Isabela p100 to be received at age 25. Will revoked by another will made 06/05/1799. Isabela is again freed but under the condition that she serve Josita, Blanchard's daughter until the age of 15.

NAME: Joseph Mauricio
REASONS: Coincoin free negress buys her son to free him
COMMENTS: In gratitude for care in illnes by Coincoin, her friend, she sells her her son. High price! She pays 50p now, they agree to serve her for the rest of her life, must pay balance to her survivors 1-1/2 yrs after her death!

NAME: Isabella

Marshall aranges for this child in the same way he did for Isabella only that if it is a boy instead of teaching him to sew he is to be taught a mechanical trade.
Declard free, "declarada libre."  Parish is Ascension. Month and year only is given.  Fictitious exact date. Names not recorded by Pat.

NAME: Ysabel
COMMENTS: Pedro Coullon, white native of the City of Luison in the Province of Ponito in France, recognizes emancipated as his natural child.  Second of his children so baptized?  Different mother. Different name and racial designation in previous record.

NAME: Louisa
COMMENTS: "which liberty she can use after my demise"  Fictitious date. Can't find in inventory.

NAME: Maria Andrea
COMMENTS: Fictitious date. Can't find in inventory.  See eman of mother and sister under Faure's will, under date of 1808.10.31.  He wills most of his property to mother and two daughters except for minor bequeststo other slaves.

NAME: Jean Sylvain
COMMENTS: Creole of his plantation in St. Domingue, "creole de son habitation de St. Domingue."

NAME: Clarise

NAME: Antoine

NAME: Angelica

NAME: Moise
COMMENTS: In recognizing the good services rendered to her (the mistress) by her slave Francoise, black female, & the mistress wishing to mark her gratitude frees this slave's son.  He is free from slavery as well as his age will permit.

NAME: Suzanne
COMMENTS: In recognizing the good services rendered to her (the mistress) by her slave Francoise, black female, & the mistress wishing to mark her gratitude frees this slave's daughter.  She is free from slavery as well as her age will permit.

NAME: Louis

NAMEMOM: Kaity free negresse. Not sure if she is the mother

NAME: Louis

NAME: Magdeleine
COMMENTS: Desiring to recognize the service she has received at different times from this slave...

NAME: Marianne
COMMENTS: "desiring to recognize the services which he has received from Marianne"... as best testimony of gratitude, etc. "et ne pouvant lui entemoignes sa reconnaissance d'une maniere desinteressee il lui accorde par ces presentes sa liberte'"...

NAME: Silvestre
REASONS: none given, but there is a payment, see will date?

NAME: Francoise
COMMENTS: no conditions

NAME: Louis

NAME: Valery

NAME: Rosalie

NAME: Rosalia

COMMENTS: This slave was born in the master's house, mother is Constanza Atis, former mulatto slave of Prevost, Juan de Torres, gives her her freedom, "le otorgue su libertad."

Bought from Miss (Genevieve) Demouy,

NAME: Letty

FAMILY: She was his mate for many years. Bot & freed her
COMMENTS: Lived with him as his wife for many years in St. Landry, but master lives in Rapides. Just bought her from Mulholland.

NAME: Genevieve
COMMENTS: Payment for freedom was 400 ps. but this slave seems too young for a self purchase, doesn't mention person who paid but it was by "comptant" on account?, no mother mentioned. Anonymous buyer was probably quadroon slave's white father.

NAME: Anne Elisabeth
COMMENTS: Master declared to priest that he gives freedom to the infant.

NAME: Robert
COMMENTS: Registration of an emancipation done by a private act dated 1807/0810; Robert, a quadroon, will remain with his mother until he can work and sustain himself. Silly is a mulatto slave of Marigny.

NAME: Hypolite
REASONS: none given, maybe because he is his son
COMMENTS: Aneta is Grand-Pre's black female slave

NAME: Eulalie
COMMENTS: Registration of a private act of emancipation dated 1807/04/17.

NAME: Francisco
COMMENTS: According to one of the clauses in the will of Maria Delande Widow Tarascon and Boisdore, Broutin 1803/05/04, he is free with the judge's permission.

NAME: Michel
REASONS: see will discussed in comments field
COMMENTS: According to one of the clauses in the will of Maria Delande Widow Tarascon and Boisdore, Broutin 1803/05/04, he is free with the judge's permission.

NAME: Gorge Clarque
REASONS: for having served me well and for much affection
COMMENTS: In Natchez Trace Collection, Center for American History, Univ. of Texas at Austin, because of great affection,  "por el mucho carino que les  tengo." See reasons for beginning of sentence.

NAME: Chimy
REASONS: for having servced me well and for much affection
COMMENTS: In Natchez Trace Collection, Center for American History, Univ. of Texas at Austin, because of great affection,  "por el mucho carino que les  tengo." See reasons for beginning of sentence.

NAME: Genevieve
COMMENTS: Document state Jean Pierre purchased Genevieve; no price is given and upon his death he wished her freed. Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 71.

NAME: Louise
COMMENTS: Registration of an emancipation, which was done privately, owner bought this slave from Charles Masicot March 8, 1808, slave is her daughter.

NAME: Carlota La Rammee
COMMENTS: Freed by decree of Judge of this Parish & City, Luis Moreau Delilet asking written permission to obtain approved emancipation document. Acquired from Margte. Montegut NL 1808/01/23/, Pedesclaux, had acquired her from Succ Maxent. Slave is 60 when freed?

NAME: Francoise
REASONS: excellent service to his dec. wife in her illness
COMMENTS: Starting in 1808, masters and freers have to go before the City and Parish Court to free their slaves. It seems wife freed this slave on her death bed before she died.  Francoise did not stop for one instant her caring for the said Mrs. Livaudais...

NAME: Louise
REASONS: faithful service & for the price & sum of 1000ps
COMMENTS: Guillaume/William Conway "comte' d'Acadie, formerly representing the said county in the legislature of this Territory. Marie Louse Conway free black woman is from New Orleans.
States he intends to free this child, but emancipation of slave chidren was outlawed by then.

NAME: Maria
COMMENTS: Acquired from Jose Mendez before notary Pedesclaux.

NAME: Genevieve
COMMENTS: Father, Jean Gaspard, acknowledges her as his natural child. Her name in margin is Genevieve Gaspard.

NAME: Marie
REASONS: good and loyal service & payment 550 ps
COMMENTS: Marie, free woman of color (FCL in French, FWOC in English) is registering her act of freedom done by private signature, done 29 of May, 1806.

NAME: Camilla
COMMENTS: Mother, mulatto slave Margarita remains under same master. Freed same day she was born.

NAME: Jean Baptiste Fouche
REASONS: his natural children baptised as free
COMMENTS: In act freeing Marguerite he recognizes his 2 natural children by her, both baptised free, using his surname Fouche.

NAME: Emerent Fouche
REASONS: his natural children baptised as free
COMMENTS: In act freeing Marguerite he recognizes his 2 natural children by her, both baptised free, using his surname Fouche.

NAME: Cophe
REASONS: fidelity and services, will of dead master
COMMENTS: LeBlanc is the executor of the Allain succession and is freeing the slave according to the wishes of Dead Auguste Allain.

NAME: Nard Maria
REASONS: by an order of the court
COMMENTS: By virtue of an order of the Court of Judge D. Luis Moreau Delislet, to authorize the freedom of this slave, decree was rendered 1808/07/06, done gratuitously (Index says Maria Nard & her children, "y sus hijos", but actual doc. has nothing about kids)

NAME: Marguerite
COMMENTS: Helene, NL renounces her & her heirs' claims to the slave Marguerite, daughter of her slave Adelaide, whom she acquired from Mr. Merieult as a black woman just arrived from Africa, "negresse brute."

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: Vergel acquired this slave from Simon D'ance; see other Vergel emancipations.

NAME: Sylvia
REASONS: for the amount of 725 ps. fts.
COMMENTS: Master obtained this slave from Gov. Grand-Pre on the 1801/05/13.

NAME: Celeste
REASONS: for the amount of 725 ps. fts.
COMMENTS: Master obtained this slave from Gov. Grand-Pre on the 1801/05/13.

NAME: Eulalia
REASONS: by a decree rendered by Judge Luis Moreau Delislet
COMMENTS: Decree dated 1808/08/04. Doesn't say why a judge rendered this decision. Might be required permission for all manumissions after Americans took over.  GMH.

NAME: Cesar
REASONS: self purchase and clause in deceased's will

NAME: Cecile
COMMENTS: John Lynd posted an intention to emancipate this slave dated 1808/08/30, and there being no opposition, Thomas Kennedy, clerk of court, certified the absence of any opposition to the emancipation.

NAME: Francisco
COMMENTS: Race of mother is not stated, "unknown father", child is mulato.

NAME: Manuel
COMMENTS: Manuel is 17 days old, acknowledged by father-master who is Portuguese.

NAME: Michel Evariste
COMMENTS: father unknown

NAME: Kaity
REASONS: see will of Faure (or Fauve) dated 1804/06/274
COMMENTS: See will of Faure dated 1804/06/27, SWFLA Papers, Vol. 11, p. 276. Freed by executor in this document.

NAME: Celeste
COMMENTS: See will of Faure dated 1804/06/27, SWFLA Papers, Vol. 11, p. 276. Freed by executor in this document.

NAME: Victoire
COMMENTS: Victoire, free black woman living down River is registering her act of Freedom, under private act dated 30th of Nov. 1807, down on Mr. Fazende's estate.

NAME: Louis
REASONS: mother pays for her son's freedom
COMMENTS: Louis Henry Faure, native of Rochelle, Province of Aunis in France, (Louis born after will)

NAME: Isabel alias Mirza
COMMENTS: Coupry is acting for Jean Baptiste Pechoux (no reason given why he is acting for Pechoux, no mention of power of attorney); decree rendered by Judge Moreau Lislet of this Parish Court.

NAME: Agathe
COMMENTS: This an emancipation by a mother of her daughter.  Mother purchased the daughter 30 oct 1804 from Louis Champagne.

NAME: Marie Rose
COMMENTS: Adult child of master who marries in church, probably father tries to free her through baptism instead of emancipation document which is by then illegal.

NAME: Marguerite
COMMENTS: In the same act Fouche recognizes his 2 natural children by Marguertie: Jean Baptiste 4 and Emerent Fouche 2 who were baptized as a free mulatto and a free mulatress.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: seeks executors to free the slave

NAME: Jean Louis
COMMENTS: seeks executor to free the slave

NAME: Virginie
COMMENTS: Mother is Marguerite mulatresse slave of testator. Freedom registered in acts. Gives her negra bruta. Wife not allowed to deal with her or her slave, but testator's kids to take care of them. See 1805/03/01 for day of her birth.

REASONS: in recompense for good services of the mother
COMMENTS: Mother's name is Annette.

NAME: Marianne
COMMENTS: For the record, no value, by reason of dispositions made by the deceased under will by which she wishes that this slave is freed after 4 years of service.

NAME: Felicianne
FAMILY: father purchased his 5 kids to free them
COMMENTS: Bought from Miguel Roig y Girona 1808/10/28 for 1800 ps. 1) Felicianne-20, 2) Babe-16, 3) Pierre-14, 4) Antoine-7, 5) Marcelitte-5, all were born at Roig's house in N.O. of his black slave Marthonne. Pierre Marly is their natural father.

NAME: Babet
FAMILY: father purchased his 5 kids to free them
COMMENTS: Bought from Miguel Roig y Girona 1808/10/28 for 1800 ps. 1) Felicianne-20, 2) Babe-16, 3) Pierre-14, 4) Antoine-7, 5) Marcelitte-5, all were born at Roig's house in N.O. of his black slave Marthonne. Pierre Marly is their natural father.

NAME: Pierre
FAMILY: father purchased his 5 kids to free them
COMMENTS: Bought from Miguel Roig y Girona 1808/10/28 for 1800 ps. 1) Felicianne-20, 2) Babe-16, 3) Pierre-14, 4) Antoine-7, 5) Marcelitte-5, all were born at Roig's house in N.O. of his black slave Marthonne. Pierre Marly is their natural father.

NAME: Antoine
FAMILY: father purchased his 5 kids to free them
COMMENTS: Bought from Miguel Roig y Girona 1808/10/28 for 1800 ps. 1) Felicianne-20, 2) Babe-16, 3) Pierre-14, 4) Antoine-7, 5) Marcelitte-5, all were born at Roig's house in N.O. of his black slave Marthonne. Pierre Marly is their natural father.

NAME: Marcellite
FAMILY: father purchased his 5 kids to free them
COMMENTS: Bought from Miguel Roig y Girona 1808/10/28 for 1800 ps. 1) Felicianne-20, 2) Babe-16, 3) Pierre-14, 4) Antoine-7, 5) Marcelitte-5, all were born at Roig's house in N.O. of his black slave Marthonne. Pierre Marly is their natural father.

NAME: Popotte
COMMENTS: Acquired from Joseph Canovas, Pedesclaux 1808/09/21.

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: Listed as negro man, this slave is considered free, "to be free on White's death."  Will dated Jan 27, 1803

NAME: Betty
COMMENTS: Listed as negro woman, this slave is considered free, "to be free on White's death."  Will dated Jan 27, 1803

NAME: Will or Williams
COMMENTS: Listed as negro man, this slave is considered free, "to be free on White's death."  Will dated Jan 27, 1803
Master is in Baltimore, left a power of attorney with Collette giving permission to baptise this child, no name, free, paternity not acknowledged.

NAME: Joseph or Jo
COMMENTS: Sold to Abner Lawson Duncan for $400, the value of 6 years service, after which slave is to be freed.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: Testamentary executor Juan Pol is caring out the wishes of the deceased Juan de Mesa who freed this slave in his will (see his will dated?).

NAME: Marie Eulalie
COMMENTS: Testamentary executor Juan Pol is caring out the wishes of the deceased Juan de Mesa who freed this slave in his will (see his will dated?).

NAME: Josephine
COMMENTS: After 40 days of public notice, Decuir granted freedom to his slave Josephine.  No age given.  Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 80.

NAME: Escapin
REASONS: well merited by his good conduct
COMMENTS: Escapin, free black, is registering his act of freedom, done by Rosalie Prejean, Widow of Francois Pecot, done with permission of her adult children, done "free", 27 June, 1807.

NAME: Augustine
COMMENTS: Notice dated 1809/05/24, no opposition, Mr. Jean Angeline, executor of the deceased Charlotte Grenoble.

NAME: Manon
REASONS: good and faithful conduct and services
COMMENTS: Cites law of March 9, 1807 obliging him to care for her in case of proved sickness, old age, insanity, etc. and accepts responsibility to do so.

NAME: Tempe
COMMENTS: Notice dated 1809/05/04, no opposition.

NAME: Luis
FAMILY: mother black, son mulato, mother freed same month
COMMENTS: Mother listed as black slave "negra esclava," replaced by free black "negra libre."  Emancipation of child recorded by Pedesclaux.  Check for duplicate. Day of month is fictitious.

FAMILY: mother negra, son mulato, mtoher freed same month
COMMENTS: Mother listed as black slave "negra esclava," replaced by free black "negra libre."  Emancipation of child recorded by Pedesclaux.  Check for duplicate. Day of month is fictitious.

NAME: Eugenia Virginia
REASONS: natural child of master's preceptor, a Frenchman
COMMENTS: Natural child of Bernardo Ferrand, a native of France and Preceptor of Eugenio Fortier.

NAME: Maria Honorina Darle
COMMENTS: Letter to Sedella,, Acadie, May 21, 1809. I pray that you baptize the little mulatress & my negress named Nanet as free, "je vous prie de baptiser la petite mulatresse a ma negresse nomme Nanet, libre."  Signed Jean Baptiste Darle

NAME: Francoise
REASONS: Good and faithful conduct and services
COMMENTS: This is a permission to free slave issued by court and emancipation.

NAME: Harry
COMMENTS: She pays $600 cash, agrees to work for St. Pierre during her life or his life. She also gets land, cattle, household utensils  after St. Pierre's death. St. Pierre gets use of them during his lifetime.

NAME: Matt Burwell
COMMENTS: Document states this is the copy of a manumission made in Winchester Virginia, on September 29, 1804.  Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 185.
Will used to free an unborn child.  Exact date not entered.  Fictitious date.

NAME: Louison
REASONS: done by an order of the court

NAME: Hipolito
COMMENTS: father listed as unknown

NAME: Dorothee
COMMENTS: Amaranthe Lassize is a free woman of color.  Guillaume Audebert has her power of Attorney and is issuing this act of freedom. Acquired from Michel Dragon.

NAME: Elizabeth dite Heloise
COMMENTS: Act of emancipation entered by Elizabeth dite Heloise freed in 1806/09/10.

NAME: Elizabeth dite Heloise, Mulata
REASONS: for her fidelity and good and loyal services
COMMENTS: This is a document with attachments. The attachments are d. 1806/09/10. Freers are the heirs of their deceased parents. It seems this emancipation actually occurred in N.O. Masters are from Plaisance. They are from northern part of Isle St. Domingue.

NAME: Vincent
COMMENTS: Master gave Clemence, the mother and his slave, a permit "un permis" indicating his will to baptize the child free.  Master lives at Bayou (St. Jean?)

NAME: Domingo Salvador Recio
COMMENTS: Child of master who is a native of Genova, same name as father, master declared at baptism before the godparents that he wanted the child batpized as free.

NAME: Magdalena
COMMENTS: Declaration filed by masters that girl was freed.

NAME: Louis
REASONS: see will dated 1809  p. 29 in this notebook
COMMENTS: Done by court order before Thomas Kennedy, free in virtue of the 8th clause in the deceased's will.

NAME: Noel
COMMENTS: Sold to Bernard de Marigny by Augustin McCarty on September 18, 1809 on the condition this mulatto be freed after reimbursing 1000 piastres.

NAME: Janet
REASONS: good qualities and services to her son
COMMENTS: Celestin de St. Maxent has power of attorney for Francois Armand who is freeing his mother Janet.

NAME: Marie Francoise Guite
COMMENTS: This slave was freed, and was living with Antoine Catalan, living on the levee. Deceased had a daughter Fanchonette Salver, free woman of color, "who declares to us to be the daughter of marriage "menage" of the said deceased."

NAME: Fanny
GROUPMEM: 3 mul kids sold to free black mom. Master is dad.
FAMILY: free black mom,3 mul kids,freed by youngest's dad
COMMENTS: Price is one dollar and "other considerations." From master to his recently freed concubine. Master recognizes youngest child as his own.  Listed as gratuitous freedom by living master although technically this is a sale.

NAME: Louis
GROUPMEM: 3 mul kids sold to free black mom. Master is dad
FAMILY: free black mom,3 mul kids,freed by youngest's dad
COMMENTS: Price is one dollar and "other considerations." From master to his recently freed concubine. Master recognizes youngest child as his own.  Listed as gratuitous freedom by living master although technically this is a sale.

NAME: Josephine
GROUPMEM: 3 mul kids sold to free black mom. Master is dad
FAMILY: free black mom,3 mul kids,freed by youngest's dad
COMMENTS: Price is one dollar and "other considerations." From master to his recently freed concubine. Master recognizes youngest child as his own.  Listed as gratuitous freedom by living master although technically this is a sale.

NAME: Francoise
GROUPMEM: Mother of above 3 mul kids freed by master/mate
FAMILY: free black mom,3 mul kids,freed by youngest's dad
COMMENTS: Price is one dollar and "other considerations." From master to his recently freed concubine. Master recognizes youngest child as his own.  Listed as gratuitous freedom by living master although technically this is a sale. This record is freedom of mother

NAME: Babe
COMMENTS: Done with permission and authority of the Orleans Parish Court, Thomas Kennedy, clerk.

NAME: Adelaide
COMMENTS: Freed upon the request of his widow on her death bed. Freed in memory of his wife and in recognition of the zealous fidelity this slave had for her mistress.

NAME: Ester
COMMENTS: Freed upon the request of his widow on her death bed. Freed in memory of his wife and in recognition of the zealous fidelity this slave had for her mistress.

NAME: Baptiste
COMMENTS: Baptiste, free black living in New Orleans, is registering his act of Freedom, under private act dated 30 Dec., 1809

NAME: Julie
COMMENTS: Freedom of Lucie black woman declared before the public notary." But she is listed as mulatto on document indicating date of birth.  GMH:  changes in racial designations from one document to another is not unusual.

NAME: Agustina Barrone
COMMENTS: slave purchased in New Orleans in January 1810

NAME: Louis Charles Bourgeois
COMMENTS: Mother listed as his slave, then it's crossed out, and "libre" entered in text and margin.

NAME: Marie Elizabeth
REASONS: in order to list his son as free
COMMENTS: Mother listed as his slave, then it's crossed out, and "libre" entered in text and margin.

NAME: Frosine
COMMENTS: Frosine has already paid buyer Hypolite Tivollier 200p of her purchase price. Condition of sale is that the buyer will let Frosine work to pay Tivollier 600 pesos.  She will be freed when this is paid.

NAME: Marie
REASONS: daughter of her freed slave, also Marie
COMMENTS: This was illegal to free a child in 1810. But she is to be freed when she reaches allowable age and will be tutored by her mother till then.

NAME: Josephine
COMMENTS: Marchand bought the girl Josephine from Goudeau and then he freed her.  Both acts are recorded in the same document. This is Spanish jurisdiction so American age limits on emancipations did not apply.

NAME: Bathelemy
COMMENTS: Marie Jeanne bought this slave from widow Montignac former resident of St. Domingue, for 600 gourdes, 16 Oct., 1809. Mr. Pacaud are representing the Berard heirs. No opposition. Barthelemy is freed.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Michel Dragon, testamentary executor of Dorothee Chauvin Beaulieu, Dragon gives 800 ps. to Francois either as a legacy or to use to buy his freedom. Done by an order of the Parish Court.

NAME: Hyacinthe
COMMENTS: by Louis Boisdore and co-heirs
by court order or by permission of the court

NAME: Chalinette
COMMENTS: Catherine bought this slave the 17 Mar 1810, Mrs. Demoulin La Chaise for 800ps.

NAME: Gilbert
COMMENTS: Louis Beaulieu is the possible father of this slave

NAME: Francisca Paula
COMMENTS: Mistress is native de San Miguel de Pucuano, in the Kingdom of Mexico, "Reyna de Mexico."

NAME: Francisca Morant
COMMENTS: Freedom stated in document before a notary public of this city.

NAME: Maria Magdalena
COMMENTS: Daughter of Miguel Furnes, native de la Island de Minorca, and of mulatresse slave.  Mistress pays Pere Antoine to baptise this quadroon child of her mulatress as free. Signed Audry Palao.

NAME: Juan
COMMENTS: Mother, slave Adelaide remains under same master.

NAME: Victorine
COMMENTS: This is a power of atty, given by Santiago Leduf to Pablo Hubeau, to free his slave in District in Baton Rouge, may be a duplicate. Check Spanish West Florida emancipations, this date.

NAME: Genevieve
COMMENTS: Freed under will of mistress.

NAME: Marie Joseph
COMMENTS: Registration of freedom of Marie Josephe dite Broussignac, gives extract of will and various St. Domingue notaries who testify to Marie Josephe's freedom, very detailed, goes on, worth studying in depth.

NAME: Marie Louise
COMMENTS: Registration of freedom of Marie Josephe dite Broussignac, gives extract of will and various St. Domingue notaries who testify to Marie Josephe's freedom, very detailed, goes on, worth studying in depth.

NAME: Charlotte
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor.

NAME: John Lewis
COMMENTS: slave purchased in May 1809

NAME: Alexandrine
COMMENTS: Done by testamentary executor Pierre Lamothe

NAME: Berthelemie
COMMENTS: Done by testamentary executor Pierre Lamothe

NAME: Marianne
COMMENTS: Done by testamentary executor Pierre Lamothe

NAME: Anne
COMMENTS: Done by testamentary executor Pierre Lamothe

NAME: Honorico Beraud
COMMENTS: Natural child of Joseph Beraud, native of Napilia in Province and of Rosalie black woman, no status given for her.  She is not described as free black or as slave.

NAME: Fanny Dodart, FWOC
COMMENTS: Registration of free status by Fany Dodart, refugee of St. Domingue, then went Satiago, Cuba. Born in St. Marc, St. Domingue, she brings witnesses before De Armas who knew her in St. Domingue and testify she was free since childhood.

NAME: Froisine
COMMENTS: Registration of an act of freedom, which ocurred in Santiago de Cuba.  Gives details about the revolution in Haiti.

NAME: Victorine
COMMENTS: Paul Hubeau is the attorney in fact of Jaques Leduf and is issuing the act of freedom.

NAME: Delphina
COMMENTS: Mother, mulatto woman Eme Poyon, remains a slave under same master.  Montreuil had petitioned the court on Jun 9, 1810 for the freedom of Delphina citing Spanish law permitting a slave to buy his freedom or someone else to do so.

NAME: Francisco
REASONS: good services and affection towards him
COMMENTS: Freer listed as resident of Attakapas District.

NAME: Kay
COMMENTS: Thomas Lilley and Louis le Gras de Vaubercey are executors of the will of Garret Papalye and are issuing this act of freedom according to his will.

NAME: George
COMMENTS: Thomas Lilley and Louis le Gras de Vaubercey are executors of the will of Garret Papalye and are issuing this act of freedom according to his will.

NAME: Julie
COMMENTS: Slave described in public notice attached to act as "negro wench"

NAME: Thisbe
COMMENTS: Slave described in public notice attached to act as "negro wench"

NAME: Agustina
COMMENTS: Mother, negress slave Elizabeth remains under same master (This is a dup. rec. same date, same slave, same Masters, mother this time has slightly different name), different vol # Vol. 18, p. 304.

NAME: Francisco
COMMENTS: Lopez holds power of atty for Bernard.

NAME: Louis dit Bellevue
COMMENTS: This is a registration of liberty that took place in St. Domingue on Apr. 5, 1803.

NAME: Marie Joseph Cristine
COMMENTS: Done with permission and authority of the Orleans Parish Court, Thomas Kennedy, clerk.

NAME: Alexandre
COMMENTS: by executor of estate of master.

NAME: Rose
REASONS: good services and affection towards her
COMMENTS: There is a note stating that Boisclaire aknowledges Rose as his daughter and wants her to stay with her mother until she is 30 yrs old.

NAME: Aimee
COMMENTS: Slave acquired in an exchange for a slave named Eulalia in 1809.

NAME: Marie Francoise
COMMENTS: Listed as of unkonwn father.  Master is a carpenter and lives in Faubourge Ste. Marie.  Master frees her at baptism.

NAME: Jean Pierre
COMMENTS: Listed as of unkonwn father.  Master is a carpenter and lives in Faubourge Ste. Marie.  Master frees her at baptism.

NAME: Otimpie Pauline
COMMENTS: She is given freedom in the will.  She is daughter of Marie Francoise, Congo, age 32.

NAME: Aime
COMMENTS: This document is sale of mother to Widow Marie C. Rigaud, noting that her 6 month old daughter was born and baptized free in Baracoa, island of Cuba

NAME: Jean Jacques
COMMENTS: There is a note that if Jean Jacques behaves as an "honest man" his emancipation will be valid, if he doesn't the emancipation will be null, then in his will Libellas revokes this condition.

NAME: Maria
FAMILY: mother of this slave is the mulatress Marie Paty

NAME: Isabelle
COMMENTS: by executor of estate of master.

NAME: Adelaide
COMMENTS: This is a registration of freedom by Adelaide, free black woman, a refugee from Cuba, freedom given to her by private act at Baracoa, Cuba dated 1808/03/12.

NAME: Marie Anne
COMMENTS: Natural child of Pascal, Indian de la Cote firme.  Note that grif still, in 1810, means black and Indian.

NAME: Louis Manville
COMMENTS: Written instructions from master to baptize this child as free

NAME: Marie Louise
COMMENTS: Mr. Edouard Cauchois, has power of atty of Sr. Bertrand Croisade, in name and as executor of Andre Fourcaud, deceased.

NAME: Bob
COMMENTS: Master posted his intention to free him, but died unexpectedly before he could do so.  Executors carried out his wishes.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: No mention of sale price. Document states Jean Louis declared his intention to free a slave belonging to him.  Jean Louis purchased Marie his daughter, from Jean Beraud on October 20, 1810. Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 106.

NAME: Marguerite
COMMENTS: Jean Louis buys her, frees her for "good conduct past 4 years."  The price he paid for her is unclear.  Probably a mate or mother.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: Bought on October 20, 1810.

NAME: Dominique
COMMENTS: Freed for warning whites and Pierre Pain free mulatto about 1811 revolt. Helped hide whites, protected their property.

NAME: Pierre
COMMENTS: Freed for warning whites, helped hide them, protected their property.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Freed for warning whites, helped hide them, protected their property, spied for them, guided the militia to place of attack.

NAME: Denya
COMMENTS: Instructed by Dominique commandeur to do this. Freed for warning whites, helped hide them, protected their property, spied for them, guided the militia to place of attack.

NAME: Henriette
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that purchaser, child's mother, frees her. Child is black, mother is mulatto.  ??

NAME: Bazile
REASONS: Stopped rebels burning down master's main house
COMMENTS: Protected master's property from rebels during 1811 revolt, put out the fire lit by rebels and fought them off when they tried to stop him from putting it out. Petition by prominent planters, approved by govt.

NAME: Jean Louis
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Jupiter
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Congo Dominique
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Salmon
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Telemacque
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Bringuisse
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Pierre Gustarde
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Marie
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Sophie
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Esther
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Jeannette
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Marie Louise
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Luzon
REASONS: good and long services to deceased during his life
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Baptiste Billot
REASONS: promise of master to slave's deceased mother
COMMENTS: Petition by prominent planters: For long services, emancipation of 13 slaves from Meuillon succession after 1811 revolt.

NAME: Marcelin
FAMILY: son bought by father to free him
COMMENTS: Buyer declared this slave his natural son and that he intends to free the slave.  Conrad, Vol. II, pt. I, p. 110.  How can black father have a mulatto son who is born a slave?

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Agrees to provide for emancipated slave, over age 30, good conduct.
