NAME: Jean Louis
COMMENTS: Acting on the family meeting of the heirs of Piseros to take action seeking the emancipation of Jean Louis when he reached his 30th birthday. Piseros acknowledegd the mulatto as a natural son.

NAME: Celeste
COMMENTS: No sale price is given in the act. Slave sold on the condition the buyer free the slave.

NAME: Prudence
COMMENTS: Document states Pierre Boutte manumitted his daughter Prudence. Conrad : vol. II, pt. I, p. 386.

NAME: Betsy Burt
COMMENTS: Betsy Burt is registering a paper that proves that she was born a free negro woman in Norfolk. The copy of the document describes her phisically in detail. She lives with 5 children in New Orleans.

NAME: Eulalie
COMMENTS: Process begins in act 3783 Nov 20, 1816 intent to free filed March 3, 1817. No opposition to emancipation is found so the slave is immeadiately freed. No conditions or price.

NAME: Noel
COMMENTS: Slave is a creole of Natchitoches and is to serve Comdet during his life and then be freed after his death. Freer checked as probably white dad, especially considering the high price paid for slave.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: Buyer was Rachal Silvestre. Sold for 10 years service, then she is to be freed.  Inventory value was only 250, sale value was 620.

NAME: Pierre Elie
COMMENTS: Elie is registering his emancipation which took place in St. Domingue on Jan 14, 1797 when he was 16.

NAME: Aime
COMMENTS: Hartel's dad is probably the dad of the slaves. He freed them in St.Domingue but because of the revolution there, they had to flee and have lost their emancipation papers. Hartel, the son, is now declaring that they are free. Only a declaration.

NAME: Fortune
COMMENTS: Hartel's dad is probably the dad of the slaves. He freed them in St.Domingue but because of the revolution there, they had to flee and have lost their emancipation papers. Hartel, the son, is now declaring that they are free. Only a declaration.

NAME: Helene
REASONS: for implicit obedience and faithful services

NAME: Celeste
COMMENTS: slave described in act as a "mulatress" but public notice in English calles her a "female negro slave"

NAME: Grace
COMMENTS: In Natchez Trace Collection, Center for American History, Univ. of Texas at Austin. Feliciana Parish. For "long & faithful services and friendly attention to the intersts of slaveholders.   Notice of intention to free her as per law."

NAME: Galthee
FAMILY: mother buying her two chidren to free them
COMMENTS: Mother comes from St. Domingue and is described as free woman of color buying her two mulatto children in order to free them. Race entered as mulatto, birthplace St. Domingue although she could have been born in Africa, for mother.
NAMEMOM: Marie Joseph AKA Zozo free woman of color

NAME: Hipolite
FAMILY: mother buying her two chidren to free them
COMMENTS: Mother comes from St. Domingue and is described as free woman of color buying her two mulatto children in order to free them. Race entered as mulatto, birthplace St. Domingue although she could have been born in Africa, for mother.
NAMEMOM: Marie Joseph AKA Zozo free woman of color

NAME: Steven
COMMENTS: No age given.  This slave is to be freed when he reaches the age of 30.  Can't tell if this freedom is subsidized by owner or buyer since we have no age or individual price.

NAME: Catherine
COMMENTS: "female negro slave". Master described as free woman of color.

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: slave over 30 freed by the estate executor

NAME: Marie Sophie
COMMENTS: in public notice slave is called a "mulato girl"

NAME: Victoire
COMMENTS: Sale on condition that slave be legally and immediately freed.

NAME: Antoine
COMMENTS: Slave is sold on the condition he be freed upon the buyer's death

NAME: Flore
COMMENTS: This slave is to be emancipated.

NAME: Barthelemy
COMMENTS: Slaves sold on condition that they be freed.

NAME: Philippe
COMMENTS: Slaves sold on condition that they be freed.

NAME: Valsin
COMMENTS: Slaves sold on condition that they be freed.

NAME: Charlote dit Lolote
COMMENTS: Slaves sold on condition that they be freed.

NAME: Cherry
COMMENTS: Mother is purchasing her two young children in order to free them.  She is described as free woman of color, the kids are mulattoes, so she is entered as a mulata.

NAME: Frederick
COMMENTS: Mother is purchasing her two young children in order to free them.  She is described as free woman of color, the kids are mulattoes, so she is entered as a mulata.

NAME: Manette
COMMENTS: Public notice is now a typed form and names and date are filled in.

NAME: Mary
COMMENTS: Age listed as 30 and upwards.

NAME: Belle
COMMENTS: No conditions or reasons for the emancipation.

NAME: Suzette
FAMILY: mother and unnamed children to enjoy freedom
COMMENTS: Freed is creole of Natchitoches, over age 30, all formalities met, she and all her children from now on to enjoy their freedom although they cannot be legally freed until age 30.  No names given.

NAME: Charlotte
REASONS: by heirs under terms of will

NAME: Charlotte
COMMENTS: Document states: Freers are the exectors of the last will of Joseph Sorel, declared that according to the terms of the will, they have freed the slave named Charlotte (FPC, 38) daughter of Nanette. Conrad: Vol II, pt. I, p. 390.

NAME: Celeste Powell
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that slaves be freed gratuitously when the law permits it. Since both children have surname Powell and buyer is named Powell, I'm assuming buyer is the acknowledged father. GMH:  changed to probably whitedad.

NAME: Henry William Powell
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that slaves be freed gratuitously when the law permits it. Since both children have surname Powell and buyer is named Powell, I'm assuming buyer is the acknowledged father.

NAME: Marie Catherine / Reine
COMMENTS: The deceased has authorized for this slave to be freed in 3 years.

NAME: Marie Catherine / Reine
COMMENTS: Inventoried at 250p for three years of service. The deceased has authorized for this slave to be freed in 3 years.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Slave to be freed as a condition of the sale.

NAME: Maria Josefa
COMMENTS: Public notice call her a "female slave" no reference to race. Act describes her as "Negress"  By executor of estate of master.

NAME: Roze
REASONS: for implicit obedience and faithful services

NAME: Jeanne Selina
COMMENTS: Slave is natural daughter of buyer. Condition of sale is that the slave be freed.
NAMEMOM: Marie Sophie free woman of color

NAME: Patty
COMMENTS: requirement that this slave be freed after she reimburses her new owner the purchase price of 350 dollars.  This is a low price and seller is absorbing a major cost of this emancipation.

NAME: Jolivet
REASONS: for good conduct and faithful service
COMMENTS: Document states" Benoit de St. Clair in consideration of good conduct and faithful service manumitted his mulatto slave Jolivet (FPC). Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 294.

NAME: Genevieve
COMMENTS: Self purchase for freedom; there is no document showing an emancipation in the record books.

NAME: Genevieve
COMMENTS: Self purchase for freedom from the estate sale dated January 1, 1810.  No manumission document found but assuming this sale document serves as proof of manumission.

NAME: Prosper
COMMENTS: Very high price for infant.  16 month old slave.  Condition:  this slave must be freed when he reaches the proper age.

NAME: Marie Jeanne
COMMENTS: Slave is to be freed as a condition of sale.

NAME: Hilaire
COMMENTS: The family declared that it was their mother's intention to free her slave Hilaire (over 45) but that she had never taken the legal steops to do so. They therefore now manumitted Hilaire.  Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 296.

NAME: Marie Louise
COMMENTS: "female slave", no race in the public notice.

NAME: Adrien
COMMENTS: Condition of the sale is that this slave be freed.

NAME: Eulalie
FAMILY: mother and 4 year old quadroon son named Congo!!
COMMENTS: Mulatto mother, quadroon son named Francois dit Congo age 4!!!  Condition of sale:  the slaves must be freed.  May be duplicated on record dated 1/04/1818 in Concordia Parish.

NAME: Congo
FAMILY: mulatto mother, 4 year old quadroon son Congo!
COMMENTS: Eulalie mulatto mother age 30 & her 4 year old quadroon son named Congo! Purchased with condition that they be freed.  Unclear how the purchaser is related to these two slaves. As is often happening, they are ignoring the age limits on emancipations.

NAME: Adam
COMMENTS: Document states: Basil Crow of St. Mary Parish frees his slave Adam. Conrad: vol. II, pt. I, p. 394.

NAME: Marie dit Nina
COMMENTS: "Female slave", no race in the public notice.

NAME: Sophia
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor

NAME: Diony
COMMENTS: by testmentary executor

NAME: Martin
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor

NAME: Magdelaine
COMMENTS: Sale on condition the buyer free the slave who is a creole of Natchitoches.  Seller got a very high price for her.

NAME: Coffy
COMMENTS: This slave is listed here for the record, "memory" and according to the executor is to be freed

NAME: Victorine
COMMENTS: Marie is appraised for 100, Victorine and Pierre are to be freed, Marie doesn't appear in sale so she might be freed, too, but she could have died.

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: Marie is appraised for 100, Victorine and Pierre are to be freed, Marie doesn't appear in sale so she might be freed, too, but she could have died.

NAME: Pierre
COMMENTS: Marie is appraised for 100, Victorine and Pierre are to be freed, Marie doesn't appear in sale so she might be freed, too, but she could have died.

NAME: Marcelin
COMMENTS: High price.  Slave is to be freed as soon as he reaches the required age.  Conrad:  vol II, pat. I, p. 305.

NAME: Wisain
COMMENTS: Slave sold on the conidtion the buyer free him.  5 month old slave.  The law against freeing slaves under 30 years of age?

NAME: Valerin
COMMENTS: This slave is to be freed when he reaches 31 years of age

NAME: Marguerite
COMMENTS: This child is the daughter of Nolasco, the deceased.  It is Nolasco's desire that the slave be freed, evidently so state in his will.

NAME: Michael
COMMENTS: Buyer was Edouard Jenkins. Listed seller as mulatto since we know him by name.  Mother to pay buyer his full purchase price before her son can be freed.  Price is quite low, so somewhat subsidized by seller/master.

NAME: Alexander
COMMENTS: Price was $600 for 3 years service. Sale on condition Alexandre would remain a slave for only 3 years or until April 1, 1821 and then be freed.  This does not appear to be a subsidized manumission at this price.

NAME: Madeleine
COMMENTS: "female slave", no race in the public notice.

NAME: Dolar
COMMENTS: Freed under the will.

NAME: Divine
FAMILY: father buying newborn daugher to free her
COMMENTS: Father buying acknowledged natural daughter, 3 mos & 5 days old, to free him when he reaches legal age. Until then buyer will treat her as if she were free. Again, black father, mulatto slave child.  GMH.Conrad: Vol. II, Pt. I, p. 314.

NAME: James Ford
COMMENTS: Bought by Allen Graham, paying for services until February 24, 1825, thereafter to be freed.  Price was $1,000. This appears to be a price unsubsidized by either seller or buyer for this skilled, young slave.  Has surname Ford.

NAME: Prince
COMMENTS: Bought by Peter Baron Boisfontaine. Henderson is testamentary executor of Hackley. Act is transfer of services of slave for 11 yrs 5 mos till 28th birthday. Born in NY 10/18/1801 & laws of that state grant freedon on 28th birthday. Price was $400.

NAME: Nancy
COMMENTS: by attorney of mistress

NAME: Jean Jacques
COMMENTS: Sale condition: slave be allowed to purchase his freedom at the rate of 10 piastre a month unitl his full price is realized and then he will be freed.

NAME: Bill
COMMENTS: Seller from Bullet Co. Kentucky

NAME: Auguste
COMMENTS: Augustin, age over 40 years, was sold by the deceased for the sum of 1000p which was paid to the deceased in order to free himself but this slave was never freed by act of liberty. This is now corrected.

NAME: Adelaide
COMMENTS: The deceased had sold Adelaide mulatress to her brother Gabriel free mulato for 500s which had been paid for her freedom, but act of freedom had never been filed. This error is now corrected.

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: Slave is freed by the estate executor in accordance with the will.

NAME: Francoise
COMMENTS: Mother and her 4 children bought by free man of color, high price. Sale made on the condition the slave and her 4 children be freed.

NAME: Joachim AKA Hiacinthe
COMMENTS: Mother and her 4 children bought by free man of color, high price. Sale made on the condition the slave and her 4 children be freed.

NAME: Edmond
COMMENTS: Mother and her 4 children bought by free man of color, high price. Sale made on the condition the slave and her 4 children be freed.

NAME: Josephine
COMMENTS: Mother and her 4 children bought by free man of color, high price. Sale made on the condition the slave and her 4 children be freed.

NAME: Jacques
COMMENTS: Mother and her 4 children bought by free man of color, high price. Sale made on the condition the slave and her 4 children be freed.

NAME: Azelie
COMMENTS: sale made on the condition the slave be freed

NAME: Eulalie
REASONS: natural love and affection for her niece
COMMENTS: Unclear if freer purchased her. Price was only p10.

NAME: Josephine
COMMENTS: Very high price. Slave will be freed as soon as she reaches the required age. Conrad: Vo. II, pt. I, p. 399.

NAME: Pierre
COMMENTS: According to the inventory this slave is freed. No records of this emanicpation appear in the orginal acts of the parish. GMH: does not matter.  Inventory & sale documents sometimes evidently used as proof of emancipation.

NAME: Ned
COMMENTS: No race given, no family groups, for any slaves.  Buyer was Jonathan Montgomery. Act is null.  Therefore, coded as not freed.

NAME: Ellin
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that the slave must be freed when she reches the age of 30. Price is reasonable.

NAME: Pauline
COMMENTS: Buyer was Jean Laurens.  Slave is sold with condition that she can buy her freedom for same price.

NAME: Betsy Labeth
COMMENTS: Public notice again does not mention race of either master or slave.

NAME: Pierre
FAMILY: 2 sons,1 daughter bought by mother to free them
COMMENTS: Act is sale of 3 natural children to their mother on the condition that slaves be emancipated.

NAME: Louis
FAMILY: 2 sons,1 daughter bought by mother to free them
COMMENTS: Act is sale of 3 natural children to their mother on the condition that slaves be emancipated.

NAME: Alexandrine
FAMILY: 2 sons,1 daughter bought by mother to free them
COMMENTS: Act is sale of 3 natural children to their mother on the condition that slaves be emancipated.

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: Condition of sale:  slave is to be freed after 5 years of service to new owner

NAME: Fidelle
TERMS: Free in 3 yrs if he pays price
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that he pay buyer, Charles White FMOC his full purchase price 3 years from date of this act of sale in order to be free. Slave came to N.O. from seller's plantation in St. Domingue. Slave is of Congo nation. Price is low.

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: The buyer, Thomas Copping, is obligated to fill out and execute the condition expressed above. Not absolutely clear from entry into records, but probably freedom when slave reimburses purchase price to buyer.  Price is low.

NAME: Lucie
COMMENTS: no conditions etc on emancipation

NAME: Julie
REASONS: for service to her son and freer's brother Andre
FAMILY: mom is freed by her son and daughter
COMMENTS: Bought by son Andre who died before he could free her. Freed by daughter Marie Nanette FPC, sole heir of her brother Andre.

NAME: Hiacinthe
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that the slave be given freedom.

NAME: Catherine
COMMENTS: "female mulatto slave"

NAME: Sanite
COMMENTS: Sanite is now a free negress in New Orleans and is registering her emancipation letter which took place in Kingston Jamaica on the 28th of Apr. of 1818.

NAME: Justine
COMMENTS: this is a registration of an emancipation that took place in Pensacola on August 27, of 1817.  Emancipation is in Spanish.

NAME: Rose
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor

NAME: Pauline
COMMENTS: Sold on condition that she be freed later.

NAME: Felicite
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that the slave is to be freed when the purchaser dies due to good services.

NAME: Alexandre
COMMENTS: No Formal emancipation document found.  No age given. Slave listed as commander of other slaves "commandeur" which ranges in meaning from driver to estate manager.

NAME: Alphonse
COMMENTS: No formal emancipation document found. Listed as son of Henriette.

NAME: Viroinque
COMMENTS: slave is to be freed on owner's death

NAME: Coffy
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor

NAME: Francois Burat
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor

NAME: Rose alias Victorine
COMMENTS: "negro wench" by testamentary executor.

NAME: Adolphe
COMMENTS: Mother buys her son.  Mother is free. Slave is 15 months old.  300p a high price.  Condition of sale is that slave is to be freed. Entered as liberto, but age limits seem to be ignored in these documents.
Condition of slave is that slave is to be freed. Father purchasing son?  No mention of age.  Did the law change? GMH: no, age limits are evidently being ignored. Marked as liberto.

NAME: Bazile
COMMENTS: Listed as called to freedom by the will of the estate of Sr. Collette and in consequence listed here as having no value, for the record only, "Appelle a la liberte par la testament de seu Sr. Collette et en consequence porte ici pour memoire." no age

NAME: Perrine
COMMENTS: Intent to free is filed on July 14, 1817

NAME: Maniga Jean Joseph dit Blaise
COMMENTS: "Male slave", no mention of race in public notice.

NAME: Marie Therese
COMMENTS: Master is listed only as a free woman of color and slave is listed a female slave, no race.

NAME: Suzanne
COMMENTS: Ffemale slave", no race in the public notice.

NAME: Celie
COMMENTS: No formal emancipation document found.

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: No formal emancipation document.  No indication of the 6 month condition on freedom of mother.

NAME: Frances
COMMENTS: by executrix of estate.

NAME: Marianne
COMMENTS: Slave must be freed as a condition of sale.   Seller from St. Charles Parish.  Price is low, partially subsidized by seller.

NAME: Desire
COMMENTS: document is illegible

NAME: Babet
COMMENTS: No formal emancipation document is found. I assume she is freed. The will does grant her liberty.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: No formal emancipation document is found. The slave is freed under the will. I assume he is freed.  No age is given in the will.

FAMILY: Mother bought and freed her daughter
COMMENTS: The freer is the mother of this slave.  Mother bought this slave for $1200 in 1817.

NAME: Sannite
COMMENTS: by attorney of master
Condition of sale is that the slave be freed.  Seller acquired slave in Santiago de Cuba and introduced him into Louisiana 12 years ago.

NAME: Gertrude
COMMENTS: Condition of sale is that she serve the said purchaser during her lifetime as slave and be freed immediately after her death.

NAME: Fanchonette
COMMENTS: called a female slave in public notice, no race.

NAME: Joseph
REASONS: following instructions in her late husband's will

NAME: Delphine
COMMENTS: Price is inventory price. To become free when she reaches the age of 30, "devant devenir libre quand elle aura attainet l'age de 30 ans."

NAME: Nancy
COMMENTS: listed as age 30 or more

NAME: Julien
COMMENTS: Listed on inventory as for the record, no value, "pour memoire." Presently in power of Orleans Parish sheriff under litigation for his freedom.  Might have been freed in 1814.

NAME: Rachel
COMMENTS: listed as age 30 or more

NAME: Etienne
COMMENTS: Mother is buyer and obliges herself to free him when he is old enough.  She is free black.

NAME: Adelaide
COMMENTS: Condition of the sale is that the slave is to be freed.  No age or age category indicated in record. Buyer is recorded as free woman of color FWOC but name indicates buyer is a male, name "Gabriel" not "Gabrielle."

NAME: Louise
REASONS: in recognition of years of service

COMMENTS: 8 month old slave

NAME: Marie
COMMENTS: no conditions etc.

NAME: Suzette
COMMENTS: Donated freedom in will. Assumption this slave is freed; no age given. Estate inventory includes point of origin and states again this slave is freed.

NAME: Caroline
COMMENTS: listed as age 30 or more

NAME: Delphine
COMMENTS: Condition of the sale is the slave will be freed at age 30. Price is low, probably subsidy by seller.

NAME: Rosette
FAMILY: free man of color buys his black slave wife
COMMENTS: Slave is wife of buyer, from succession of community of Francois Jacques Ozenne and Dame Marguerite Decuir his wife, bought at auction.

NAME: Victoire
COMMENTS: serve her mistress untill her mistress' death

NAME: Pauline
COMMENTS: by testamentary executor

NAME: Matias
COMMENTS: Mother of slave is freer.  She bought Matias in New Orleans from Fulgence Trepagnier in 1817. Don't know if slave is freed. Document is only the 40 day petition to let people know of the planned emanicpation.

NAME: Theresa
COMMENTS: Slave is too young to be freed until she is 30.  She will be under the care and guardianship of Francoise Nichel a free quadroon. When she reaches the age of 30 she will be freed.

NAME: Louis
COMMENTS: "negro man slave"

NAME: Chalinette
COMMENTS: age listed as over 30

NAME: Louis
COMMENTS: under the express obligation that the said acquirer will proceed immediately to legally free the said slave, "sous l'obligation express que contracte le dit acquereur de faire procede immediatement a l'enfranchisement legal du dit esclave."

NAME: Gabriel Oscar
COMMENTS: Sold with mother & Alfred 7.5 yr old mulatto brother. Condition of sale:  Gabriel Oscar becomes free and that his legal freedom will be acquired as soon as he attains the necessary age. When boy reaches age 10-12 he will be put in a capable profession.

NAME: Fatime
COMMENTS: Freer is entered as FWOC but first name is Laurence so entered as a male. Slave to be freed when she pays purchase price to buyer. No price in record. Belongs to seller as dependant of a plantation in Parish of Leogone in St. Domingue.

NAME: Marthe
COMMENTS: "female slave" in public notice, no race

NAME: Mamedoo
COMMENTS: age is actually "above 30 years of age"

NAME: Charles Brown
COMMENTS: listed as age 30 or more

NAME: Agnes
REASONS: good and loyal service and fideltiy

NAME: Fillette
COMMENTS: by executor of estate

NAME: Celeste
REASONS: Good and faithful conduct and services

NAME: Felicite
COMMENTS: serve Magdelaine Rillieux untill Magdelaine's death.  By testamentary executor.

NAME: Alexis
COMMENTS: Young slaves, to be treated as free and emancipated when upon reaching the right age. These slaves are to remain with freers and can only be transferred by the freers and transferred NOT AS SLAVES.

NAME: Justine
COMMENTS: 10 month old slave freed, to be treated as free person from now until day of formal emanicpation.  Will remain with the freers and can only be transferred by the freer and then only as a free person not a slave.

NAME: Edward
GROUPMEM: 2 sons of buyer both under age 4
FAMILY: father buys 2 sons both under age 4
COMMENTS: Very high price.  No mention of emancipation, but I assume they will eventually be freed and meanwhile treated as any other free children.

NAME: Jem
GROUPMEM: 2 sons of buyer both under age 4
FAMILY: father buys 2 sons both under age 4
COMMENTS: Very high price.  No mention of emancipation, but I assume they will eventually be freed and meanwhile treated as any other free children.

NAME: Therese
REASONS: good and faithful service to her and her family
COMMENTS: Document is the will; no information if freed or not.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: "male slave", no race in public notice

NAME: Jim
COMMENTS: this  slave was freed in the will

NAME: Joseph
REASONS: Wish of the deceased Francois Saulet

NAME: Clarice
COMMENTS: He also leaves Clarice his furniture and other household effects.

NAME: Maria
COMMENTS: Donation from mistress to freer for purpose of educating her and freeing her as soon as the law allows.  Mistress and freer are both named Riviere. Freer is free negress.

NAME: Joseph
REASONS: good and faithful service and other cause

NAME: Fortune
COMMENTS: No conditions.  Slave is freed by Lovekin's estate executor

NAME: Catherine
COMMENTS: "female slave", no race.

NAME: Clemos
COMMENTS: In consideration of the long and faithful services which she has rendered me.

NAME: Francois
COMMENTS: Sale made on the condition that the slave be freed.  Seller acquired slave 20 years ago.

NAME: Louis
COMMENTS: No conditions.  Slave freed by son Joseph Boisdore fils, same name as father, in accordance with the will.

NAME: Eugene
COMMENTS: Slave is freed by Cousin's executor. The 1800 dollars is provided by friends of said slave. Charcater:  honest conduct, not a runaway, not a robber and no conviction of criminal misdimeanors

NAME: Elizabeth
COMMENTS: slave becomes free only on master's death

NAME: Julien
COMMENTS: "Falgo Laguerre" to be freed  when he reaches the age ascribed by law.

NAME: Philippe
COMMENTS: Mother of slave is slave Manon of the seller. Slave sold with condition that he be freed at a later unspecified date. Buyer is from St. Landry, Opelousas. No surnames recorded here for either seller or buyer

NAME: Catherine
COMMENTS: Sale is made on the condition that Catherine be freed.  High price.

NAME: Francoise
COMMENTS: This is only a petition; emancipation pending.
Sale made on the condition the slave be freed 2 years from the date of sale.

NAME: Caroline
COMMENTS: Microfilm is illegible for most of the document (poor copy). Slave is apparently the personal servant of her masters.

NAME: Clemos
COMMENTS: Freer is the estate executor; freed inaccordance with the will of Michel Lavergne.

NAME: Betsey
COMMENTS: "Female slave," no race given in public notice.

NAME: Justine Marie
COMMENTS: Condition: slave remain with mother Fanny until 10 years old. Said slave sold under consideration of her freedom which the said mister purchaser obligates himself to give legally.

NAME: Constance Boyer
COMMENTS: Slave is to be freed as condition of sale. 3,000 French francs is price of sale. Did not convert because price formula unclear at this late date.

NAME: Manette
SKILLS: litte bit of a cook, laundress
COMMENTS: Inventory price. All of them "pour memoire." The deceased promised them their freedom verbally. They are all at Terre aux Boeufs. Whose slaves are the children until age 30?

NAME: Etienne
SKILLS: litte bit of a cook, laundress
COMMENTS: Inventory price. All of them "pour memoire." The deceased promised them their freedom verbally. They are all at Terre aux Boeufs. Whose slaves are the children until age 30?

NAME: Eugene
SKILLS: litte bit of a cook, laundress
COMMENTS: Inventory price. All of them "pour memoire." The deceased promised them their freedom verbally. They are all at Terre aux Boeufs. Whose slaves are the children until age 30?

NAME: Joseph
COMMENTS: Slave is to be treated as free from this date forward and to give freedom to said mulatto as soon as he has attained the required age allowed by law for their freedom

NAME: Caroline
COMMENTS: Slave is freed by the estate executor, freed in accordance with the will of Francois Pitre Sr.

NAME: Ruben
COMMENTS: To be freed 8 years after inventory date listed as 9/4/1820. Sale price is $290 for 8 yrs. service.

NAME: Thereze
COMMENTS: Very high price. Quadroon infant is to be freed and to continue living with her mother Prudence.

NAME: Felicite
COMMENTS: No value, should be freed.  A black woman.

NAME: Rephie
FAMILY: mother buys her 2 litte children to free them
COMMENTS: Natural mother purchased her 2 children and promises to be a good mother, free them, and treat them as free people until legal freedom is possible. Low price.
